Frequently Asked Questions

Is VelvetCurtain.io responsible for the rise in "that guy" energy? +
We provide the tools. You wield the power. VelvetCurtain.io is not responsible for any cold emails sent, pitch decks created, or LinkedIn posts published while under the influence of our ambient mixes. "That guy" was already in there. We just turned up the volume.
Is this actually scientifically proven? +
We conducted a study with 12 participants in a converted garage in Palo Alto. All 12 reported feeling "like a founder." The study was not peer-reviewed, replicated, or published anywhere except a blog post on a site that no longer exists. So: yes.
What happened to Thaddeus and Penny? +
Thaddeus pivoted to crypto and now describes himself as a "Web3 Confidence Architect" on his LinkedIn, which has 340 followers, 12 of whom are real people. Penny left to become a sound engineer for ASMR cat videos and has never been happier. She was always the talented one.
Skrillex or Avicii? +
This question destroyed our forum. Literally. The thread reached 4,000 posts before someone doxxed a moderator named TrapLordKevin and we had to shut the whole thing down. The official VelvetCurtain position is: Avicii for feelings, Skrillex for conviction. Both for the full 2012 experience. RIP the forum (2023-2023).
Can I get a refund? +
Confidence is non-refundable. This is both our terms of service and a life philosophy. Also our Stripe account was suspended in October 2023 so technically we couldn't process a refund even if we wanted to.

Here's the thing nobody tells you about confidence: the real stuff and the fake stuff feel exactly the same from the inside. I spent $14,000 of my parents' money on a startup that was basically Spotify but worse. I walked into that Y Combinator interview convinced I was going to be on the cover of Wired. They didn't even let me finish my pitch. But for about nine months in 2012, I was the happiest I've ever been, because I hadn't learned yet that believing in something doesn't make it real. This website is a monument to that feeling. I miss it every day.
